My Profolio Website

Made from scratch utilizing HTML/CSS and a little bit of Javascript.

I am currently working on implementing media queries in order to make the website compatible with multiple screen sizes (tablets, smartphones, wide-screens, etc) and continuing to learn Javascript in order to allow for smoother transitions when loading pages and its contents!

Class Projects: Computer Architecture

Projects done during CS211: Computer Architecture

PA1: Worked with basic data structures such as Linked Lists, Stacks and Queues, and Matricies

PA2: Worked with graphs such as Undirected, Directed, Weighted, and Directed Acyclic as well as common graph algorithms such as BFS, DFS, and Dijkstraâ€™s Shortest Path Algorithm

PA3: Wrote a C program to convert numbers between different data representations such as Unsigned Binary, Two's Complement Binary, and I-EEE-FP Representation

PA5: Wrote a C program that could simulate a 1 and 2-level cache

Class Grade: A

View Projects

Personal Project: What are the Odds?

Imitated an online version of the popular game of chance: What are the Odds in which a short description can be found here

The website was modeled to look like a classic Game Boy using CSS (SASS) and used JavaScript in order to perform the game logic mainly utilizing DOM Manipulation

Media Queries were also utilized in order to make the webpage compatible with regular screens, big tablets, tablets, and smartphone screen sizes.
